hero.positioning: Production AI/ML Infrastructure Engineer specializing in serverless data platforms, enterprise RAG systems, and high-availability APIs at The Cigna Group
credibility: 95% cost reduction, 60% speed improvement on production systems

experience.problem: Small group insurance underwriters needed faster access to actuarial data for premium quotations, but legacy PostgreSQL infrastructure was expensive and slow, creating bottlenecks in quote generation that directly impacted revenue.
experience.solution: Architected serverless data platform processing 80K+ files across 320+ DynamoDB tables using S3-triggered Lambda functions with Protobuf parsing and Redshift Spectrum external tables. Optimized DynamoDB runtime configuration by troubleshooting hot partition issues and refactoring nested array structures, achieving 40% performance improvement.
experience.scale: 80K+ files, 320+ tables, 10K+ columns with strict data typing through versioned JSON schemas
experience.outcome: Reduced infrastructure costs 95% ($24K annually) while improving underwriter quote generation speed 60%, directly supporting millions in annual premium revenue. Built observability infrastructure achieving 99.9% data validation accuracy, securing FY2026 executive budget approval.

experience.problem: Engineering teams lacked efficient access to enterprise metadata scattered across Atlassian and GitHub, while Lambda-based ETL pipelines hit timeout limits processing 100K+ daily records for 200+ teams.
experience.solution: Re-engineered ETL architecture from Lambda to Glue achieving 30% efficiency improvement and zero timeout incidents through horizontal scaling. Built RESTful APIs ingesting enterprise metadata with Neo4j graph database for LLM RAG optimization, improving retrieval speeds 50%.
experience.scale: 100K+ daily records, 200+ engineering teams, 15-20 FTE hours saved weekly
experience.outcome: Secured $2M funding for AI infrastructure expansion by leading MetagenAI project, enabling AI department growth from 5 to 15+ headcount. Resolved critical production outage within 2 hours leading 100+ person incident response, preventing $500K+ in claims processing errors.

experience.problem: Members needed self-service provider network searches, but on-premises data retrieval took hours, driving call center volume and reducing satisfaction scores.
experience.solution: Designed real-time data synchronization system between DynamoDB and AppSync GraphQL endpoints, reducing query latency from hours to <1 minute. Led production release of AWS Glue jobs for provider data migration from on-premises to cloud.
experience.scale: 1500+ daily users, 220K+ annual queries, 600+ daily active users
experience.outcome: Reduced data retrieval times 30%, improving member self-service and reducing call center inquiries 20% (estimated $150K+ annual savings). Achieved 15% reduction in data-related production incidents, preventing $2.5M in subsidiary budget overruns.

experience.problem: Post-COVID patient outcomes were poorly understood across 2.5M+ member population, limiting ability to target high-risk cohorts for preventive interventions.
experience.solution: Analyzed 2.5M+ longitudinal patient records using regression analysis and time series techniques. Built predictive models using gradient boosting and EDA, then segmented high-risk cohorts using K-means clustering and KNN classification.
experience.scale: 2.5M+ patient records analyzed across longitudinal dataset
experience.outcome: Informed targeted interventions lowering hospitalization rates 10%. Won 1st place in TECDP Summer Innovation Project 2022, recognized by CEO David Cordani during company-wide town hall, securing full-time return offer.

projects.title: SUWP Data Modernization Program
projects.subtitle: Serverless Underwriting Analytics Platform
projects.description: Modernized underwriting analytics infrastructure powering quotation pricing for small group insurance market, directly feeding actuarial calculations used by underwriters and data science teams to generate premium quotes.
projects.problem: Legacy PostgreSQL infrastructure was expensive ($24K annually) and slow, creating bottlenecks in quote generation that directly impacted millions in annual premium revenue.
projects.architecture: Serverless data platform with S3-triggered Lambda functions parsing Protobuf files, writing to 320+ DynamoDB tables with yyyy/mm/dd/hh partitioning, and Redshift Spectrum external tables for analytics queries. CloudWatch and Athena observability infrastructure tracks Lambda execution metrics and data validation.
projects.scale: 80K+ files, 320+ tables, 10K+ columns, 99.9% data validation accuracy

projects.title: CollateralIQ
projects.subtitle: AI-Powered Compliance Platform
projects.description: Built AI-powered compliance platform to proactively audit 266M+ annually produced regulated collateral documents, addressing critical regulatory risk after Virginia Bureau of Insurance issued findings three consecutive years.
projects.problem: Manual compliance audits were reactive, time-consuming (70% manual prep time), and exposed company to civil monetary penalties of $100K-$1M+ per violation.
projects.architecture: End-to-end Airflow DAG workflows extract claim data from Teradata/Oracle, download PDFs, and persist structured metadata with full lineage in PostgreSQL. PHI/PII masking via AWS Comprehend Medical routes sanitized content through LLMs for state-specific disclosure validation. Human-in-the-loop review UI enables compliance reviewers to accept/reject AI findings with rationale.
projects.scale: 266M+ annual documents, 2,000 records per batch, parallelized multi-threaded workers
impact: 70% reduction in manual audit prep time

projects.title: MetagenAI
projects.subtitle: Enterprise Metadata Intelligence Platform
projects.description: Built metadata intelligence platform ingesting enterprise data from Atlassian and GitHub to optimize LLM Retrieval-Augmented-Graph (RAG) response efficiency within Neo4j graph database.
projects.problem: Engineering teams lacked efficient access to enterprise metadata, causing slow time-to-insight and duplicated effort across 200+ teams.
projects.architecture: RESTful APIs consume Atlassian and GitHub endpoints, storing structured metadata in PostgreSQL with Redis caching. Neo4j graph database enables LLM RAG optimization with relationship traversal. React frontend provides search and exploration interface.
projects.scale: 200+ engineering teams, 15-20 FTE hours saved weekly
impact: Enabled AI department growth from 5 to 15+ headcount

projects.title: Provider Inquiry Tool
projects.subtitle: High-Availability Provider Network API
projects.description: Deployed high-availability provider network inquiry system within MyCigna customer application to improve member experience and enable self-service provider searches.
projects.problem: On-premises data retrieval took hours, driving call center volume and reducing customer satisfaction scores.
projects.architecture: Real-time data synchronization between DynamoDB and AppSync GraphQL endpoints with Lambda resolvers. Databricks-to-AWS migration pipeline using S3, Glue, and Lambda. Splunk dashboards track AWS service errors and performance metrics.
projects.scale: 1500+ daily users, 220K+ annual queries, <1 minute latency
impact: Query latency reduced from hours to <1 minute
$150K+ estimated annual savings in support costs

projects.title: Enterprise ETL Re-Architecture
projects.subtitle: Lambda to Glue Migration
projects.description: Re-engineered ETL architecture from Lambda to Glue to eliminate timeout incidents and improve reliability for business-critical analytics systems serving 200+ engineering teams.
projects.problem: Lambda-based ETL pipelines hit 15-minute timeout limits processing 100K+ daily records, causing data delays and reliability issues.
projects.architecture: Horizontal scaling with AWS Glue jobs processing 100K+ records daily. Eliminated serverless execution limits through distributed processing.
impact: Improved data pipeline reliability for 200+ teams

projects.title: COVID-19 Population Health Analytics
projects.subtitle: Predictive Risk Modeling
projects.description: Analyzed 2.5M+ longitudinal patient records to identify post-COVID outcome trends and segment high-risk cohorts for targeted interventions.
projects.problem: Post-COVID patient outcomes were poorly understood, limiting ability to target preventive interventions effectively.
projects.architecture: Regression analysis and time series techniques on 2.5M+ patient records. Predictive models using gradient boosting and EDA. K-means clustering and KNN classification for cohort segmentation.
impact: Won 1st place in TECDP Summer Innovation Project 2022
CEO recognition during company-wide town hall

philosophy.title: Systems Philosophy
philosophy.content:
Production AI systems require more than models that train—they require systems that run. After building platforms serving 1500+ daily users and securing $2M in funding, I've learned that reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency matter as much as model performance.

Scalability isn't about handling theoretical load—it's about making architectural decisions that balance performance, cost, and complexity. Serverless architectures can reduce costs 95% while improving speed 60%, but only with careful design around hot partitions, data typing, and observability. I've optimized databases by 40% not through better algorithms, but through understanding access patterns and partition strategies.

ML production differs fundamentally from experimentation. Notebooks that train models become systems that ingest data, mask PHI/PII, route through LLMs, implement human-in-the-loop governance, and maintain audit trails. The difference between a prototype and a production system is observability infrastructure, fault tolerance, and separation of concerns.

Cost and performance aren't opposing forces—they're design constraints that drive better architecture. Reducing infrastructure costs from $24K to $90 annually while improving performance 60% required rethinking the entire stack, not just optimizing existing code. Every architectural decision has a cost dimension: compute, storage, data transfer, and operational overhead.

Reliability is built through observability and governance. CloudWatch dashboards, Athena queries, and custom logging aren't overhead—they're how you achieve 99.9% data validation accuracy and zero timeout incidents. Human-in-the-loop systems aren't bureaucracy—they're how you maintain explainability and regulatory compliance while leveraging AI capabilities.
